member.name: T:GenericParsing.GenericParserAdapter
member.summary: The is used to modify the to allow it parse a file and place them into various formats.

member.name: T:GenericParsing.GenericParser
member.summary: The class is designed to be a flexible and efficient manner of parsing various flat files formats.

member.name: F:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DefaultMaxBufferSize
member.summary: Defines the default max buffer size (4096).

member.name: F:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DefaultMaxRows
member.summary: Defines the max rows value (0 = no limit).

member.name: F:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DefaultSkipStartingDataRows
member.summary: Defines the number of skip starting data rows (0).

member.name: F:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DefaultExpectedColumnCount
member.summary: Defines the number of expected columns (0 = no limit).

member.name: F:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DefaultFirstRowHasHeader
member.summary: Defines the default first row has a header (false).

member.name: F:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DefaultTrimResults
member.summary: Defines the default value for trim results (false).

member.name: F:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DefaulStripControlCharacters
member.summary: Defines the default value for stripping control characters (false).

member.name: F:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DefaulSkipEmptyRows
member.summary: Defines the default value for skipping empty rows (true).

member.name: F:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DefaultTextFieldType
member.summary: Defines the default value for text field type (Delimited).

member.name: F:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DefaultFirstRowSetsExpectedColumnCount
member.summary: Defines the default for first row sets the expected column count (false).

member.name: F:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DefaultColumnDelimiter
member.summary: Defines the default column delimiter (',').

member.name: F:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DefaultTextQualifier
member.summary: Defines the default text qualifier ('\"').

member.name: F:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DefaultCommentCharacter
member.summary: Defines the default comment row character ('#').

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser.SetDataSource(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the file as the datasource.
member.remarks: If the parser is currently parsing a file, all data associated with the previous file is lost and the parser is reset back to its initial values.
member.param: The containing the name of the file to set as the data source.

example.code: using (GenericParser p = new GenericParser()) p.SetDataSource(@"C:\MyData.txt");

member.exception: Supplying .
Supplying a filename to a file that does not exist.
Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

The of the file being referenced.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser.Read

summary.para: Parses the data-source till it arrives at one row of data.

returns.para: - Successfully parsed a new data row.
- No new data rows were found.

remarks.para: If it finds a header, and its expecting a header row, it will not stop at the row and continue on till it has found a row of data.
Internally, the header row is treated as a data row, but will not cause the parser to stop after finding it.

member.exception: Attempting to read without properly setting up the .
Thrown in the situations where the cannot continue due to a conflict between the setup and the data being parsed.

member.summary: Releases the underlying resources of the .

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser.GetColumnIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the index of the column based on its name.

remarks.para: column name is not a valid name for a column.
If the column is not found, the column index will be -1.

member.param: The name of the column to get the index for.
member.returns: The index of the column with the name strColumnName. If none exists, -1 will be returned.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser.GetColumnName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the name of the column based on its index.
member.param: The column index to return the name for.
member.remarks: If the column is not found or the index is outside the range of possible columns, will be returned.
member.returns: The name of the column at the given index, if none exists is returned.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser._InitializeParse
member.summary: Initializes internal variables that are maintained for internal tracking of state during parsing.
member.exception: In the event that the wasn't setup properly, this exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser._GetNextCharacter
member.summary: Gets the next character from the input buffer (and refills it if necessary and possible).

returns.para: - A new character was read from the data source.
- No more characters are available in the data source.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser._SkipCommentRows
member.summary: Reads till a non-comment row is found.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser._SkipToEndOfText
member.summary: Reads till the end of the text is found.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser._CleanUpParser(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes all references to internally allocated resources. Depending on , it will free up all of the internal resources to prepare the instance for disposing.

param.name: blnCompletely
param.para: - Clean-up the entire parser (used for disposing the instance).
- Clean-up the parser to all it to be reused later.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser._ParseRowType
member.summary: Examines the beginning of the row and the current state information to determine how the parser will interpret the next line and updates the internal RowType accordingly.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser._SetColumnNames
member.summary: Takes the data parsed from the row and places it into the ColumnNames collection.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser._HandleEndOfRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Handles the logic necessary for updating state due to a row ending.
member.param: The index of the last character in the column.
member.exception: If parsing a fixed width format and the number of columns found differs what was expected, this exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser._ExtractColumn(System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes a range within the character buffer and extracts the desired string from within it and places it into the DataArray. If an escape character has been set, the escape characters are stripped out and the unescaped string is returned.
member.param: The index of the last character in the column.
member.exception: In the event that the is set to a value of greater than zero (which is by default for a fixed width format) and the number of columns found differs from what's expected, this exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser._CopyRemainingDataToFront(System.Int32)
member.summary: When the buffer has reached the end of its parsing and there are no more complete columns to be parsed, the remaining data must be moved up to the front of the buffer so that the next batch of data can be appended to the end.
member.param: The index that starts the beginning of the data to be moved.
member.exception: In the event that the entire buffer is full and a single column cannot be parsed from it, parsing can no longer continue.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser._GetColumnName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the name of the Column based on its ColumnIndex.
member.param: The column index to return the name for.
member.remarks: If the column is not found or the index is outside the range of possible columns, will be returned.
member.returns: The name of the column at the given ColumnIndex, if none exists is returned.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser._GetColumnIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the index of the Column based on its Name.

remarks.para: column name is not a valid name for a column.
If the column is not found, the column index will be -1.

member.param: The name of the column to find the index for.
member.returns: The index of the column with the name strColumnName. If none exists, -1 will be returned.

member.summary: Creates a detailed message for a parsing exception and then throws it.

member.name: M:GenericParsing.GenericParser._InitializeConfigurationVariables
member.summary: Initializes the parsing variables for the GenericParser.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets whether or not the instance has been disposed of.

value.para: - Indicates the instance has be disposed of.
- Indicates the instance has not be disposed of.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.ColumnWidths
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer array indicating the number of characters needed for each column.
member.value: An int[] containing the number of spaces for each column.

remarks.para: If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.
By setting this property, the and are automatically updated.

member.exception: Passing in an empty array or an array of values that have a number less than one.
Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.MaxBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the internal buffer used to cache the data.
member.value: The maximum size of the internal buffer to cache data from the datasource.

remarks.para: Maintaining the smallest number possible here improves memory usage, but trades it off for higher CPU usage. The must be at least the size of one column of data, plus the Max(column delimiter width, row delimiter width).
Default: 4096
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Setting the value to something less than one.
Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.MaxRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of rows to parse.
member.value: The maximum number of rows to parse.

remarks.para: Setting the value to zero will cause all of the rows to be returned.
Default: 0
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.SkipStartingDataRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows of data to ignore at the start of the file.
member.value: The number of data rows to initially skip in the datasource.

remarks.para: The header row (if present) and comment rows will not be taken into account when determining the number of rows to skip. Setting the value to zero will cause no rows to be ignored.
Default: 0
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.DataRowNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows of data that have currently been parsed.
member.value: The number of rows of data that have been parsed.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.FileRowNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets how many rows in the file have been parsed.
member.value: The number of rows in the file that have been parsed.
member.remarks: The property is read-only and includes all rows possible (header, comment, and data).

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.ExpectedColumnCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the expected number of columns to find in the data. If the number of columns differs, an exception will be thrown.
member.value: The number of columns expected per row of data.

remarks.para: Setting the value to zero will cause the to ignore the column count in case the number changes per row.
Default: 0
By setting this property, the and are automatically updated.
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.FirstRowHasHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the first row of data in the file contains the header information.

remarks.para: Default:
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.TrimResults
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to trim the values for each column.

value.para: - Indicates to trim the resulting strings.
- Indicates to not trim the resulting strings.

remarks.para: Trimming only occurs on the strings if they are not text qualified. So by placing values in quotes, it preserves all whitespace within quotes.
Default:
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.StripControlChars
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to strip control characters out of the input.

value.para: - Indicates to remove control characters from the input.
- Indicates to leave control characters in the input.

remarks.para: Setting this to can cause a performance boost.
Default:
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.SkipEmptyRows
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to skip empty rows in the input.

value.para: - Indicates to skip empty rows in the input.
- Indicates to include empty rows in the input.

remarks.para: Default:
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.IsCurrentRowEmpty
member.summary: Gets whether or not the current row is an empty row.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.TextFieldType
member.summary: Gets or sets the of the data encoded in the rows.

remarks.para: By setting , this property is automatically set.
Default:
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.FirstRowSetsExpectedColumnCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns in the header/first data row determines the expected number of columns in the data.

value.para: - Indicates the data's column count should match the header/first data row's column count.
- Indicates the data's column count does not necessarily match the header/first data row's column count.

remarks.para: If set to , will automatically be set to .
Default:
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.State
member.summary: Gets the value indicating the current internal state of the parser.
member.value: The property is read-only and is used to return information about the internal state of the parser.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.ColumnDelimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets the character used to match the end of a column of data.
member.value: Contains the character used to delimit a column.

remarks.para: By setting this property, the is automatically updated. This is only meaningful when performing delimited parsing.
Default: ','
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.TextQualifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the character that is used to enclose a string that would otherwise be potentially trimmed (Ex. " this ").
member.value: The character used to enclose a string, so that row/column delimiters are ignored and whitespace is preserved.

remarks.para: The Text Qualifiers must be present at the beginning and end of the column to have them properly removed from the ends of the string. Furthermore, for a string that has been enclosed with the text qualifier, if the text qualifier is doubled up inside the string, the characters will be treated as an escape for the literal character of the text qualifier (ie. "This""Test" will translate with only one double quote inside the string).
Setting this to can cause a performance boost, if none of the values are expected to require escaping.
Default: '\"'
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.EscapeCharacter
member.summary: Gets or sets the character that is used to escape a character (Ex. "\"This\"").
member.value: The character used to escape row/column delimiters and the text qualifier.

remarks.para: Upon parsing the file, the escaped characters will be stripped out, leaving the desired character in place. To produce the escaped character, use the escaped character twice (Ex. \\). Text qualifiers are already assumed to be escaped if used twice.
Setting this to can cause a performance boost, if none of the values are expected to require escaping.
Default: null
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.CommentCharacter
member.summary: Gets or sets the character that is used to mark the beginning of a row that contains purely comments and that should not be parsed.
member.value: The character used to indicate the current row is to be ignored as a comment.

remarks.para: Default: '#'
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the data found in the current row of data by the column index.
member.value: The value of the column at the given index.
member.param: The index of the column to retreive.
member.remarks: If the column is outside the bounds of the columns found or the column does not possess a name, it will return .

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the data found in the current row of data by the column name.
member.value: The value of the column with the given column name.
member.param: The name of the column to retreive.
member.remarks: If the header has yet to be parsed (or no header exists), the property will return .

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.ColumnCount
member.summary: Gets the number of columns found in the current row.
member.value: The number of data columns found in the current row.
member.remarks: The property is read-only. The number of columns per row can differ, if allowed.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParser.LargestColumnCount
member.summary: Gets the largest column count found thusfar from parsing.
member.value: The largest column count found thusfar from parsing.
member.remarks: The property is read-only. The LargestColumnCount can increase due to rows with additional data.

member.name: P:GenericParsing.GenericParserAdapter.SkipEndingDataRows

member.name: T:GenericParsing.ParsingException
